title: Hierarchical NeuroSymbolic Approach for Action Quality Assessment
abstract: arXiv:2403.13798v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Action quality assessment (AQA) applies computer vision to quantitatively assess the performance or execution of a human action. Current AQA approaches are end-to-end neural models, which lack transparency and tend to be biased because they are trained on subjective human judgements as ground-truth. To address these issues, we introduce a neuro-symbolic paradigm for AQA, which uses neural networks to abstract interpretable symbols from video data and makes quality assessments by applying rules to those symbols. We take diving as the case study. We found that domain experts prefer our system and find it more informative than purely neural approaches to AQA in diving. Our system also achieves state-of-the-art action recognition and temporal segmentation, and automatically generates a detailed report that breaks the dive down into its elements and provides objective scoring with visual evidence. translated_title: 分层神经符号方法用于动作质量评估
translated_abstract: 动作质量评估（AQA）应用计算机视觉定量评估人类动作的表现或执行。当前的AQA方法是端到端的神经模型，缺乏透明度并且易受偏见，因为它们是基于主观人类判断作为地面真相进行训练的。为了解决这些问题，我们介绍了一种用于AQA的神经符号范式，该方法使用神经网络从视频数据中抽象出可解释的符号，并通过将规则应用于这些符号进行质量评估。我们以跳水为案例研究。我们发现领域专家更喜欢我们的系统，并发现其比纯神经方法更具信息量。我们的系统还实现了最先进的动作识别和时间分割，并自动生成了一份详细报告，将跳水分解为其元素，并提供带有视觉证据的客观评分。经一组领域专家验证，
tldr: 引入分层神经符号范式的动作质量评估方法，在跳水中取得了领先的表现，通过从视频数据中提取可解释符号并应用规则进行质量评估，优于端到端神经模型，同时实现了动作识别和时间分割，并生成详细报告。
en_tdlr: Introducing a hierarchical neuro-symbolic paradigm for action quality assessment, achieving state-of-the-art performance in diving by extracting interpretable symbols from video data and applying rules for assessment, outperforming end-to-end neural models, along with action recognition and temporal segmentation, and generating detailed reports.
